alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 26 at 1:10PM PST until March 01 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM PST MONDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Blizzard Warning in effect through 10am Wednesday. * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, periods of heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 6 to 12 inches, except up to 18 inches above 7000 feet. Up to 3 inches along and east of US- 395. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, except 8 to 16 inches east of US-395. 3 to 4 feet are possible for areas above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 1 PM PST Monday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 1 PM Monday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be near impossible with near zero visibility at times Monday through early Wednesday morning. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. If you risk travel you could become stranded in vehicles for hours.
info.instruction: Blizzard conditions could produce life threatening situations. Avoid unnecessary travel! Road crews and first responders may not be able to rescue you. Stay indoors until the snow and wind subside. Even a short walk could be deadly if you become disoriented. Have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
